subject: Sleep
title: Idiopathic Hypersomnia
description: Learn Idiopathic Hypersomnia in one minute.

hook.text: A young woman sleeps 11 hours, sets five alarms, and still can barely drag herself out of bed every morning.

buildup.text: Idiopathic hypersomnia causes excessive sleepiness and unrefreshing sleep despite long sleep duration.

discovery.text: Unlike narcolepsy, there's no cataplexy and no clear cause. Sleep studies often look deceptively normal.

twist.text: Patients describe a state called sleep drunkenness, intense grogginess and confusion upon waking.

climax.text: It takes years to diagnose because doctors assume the patient is just not sleeping enough or is depressed.

punchline.text: Sleeping eleven hours and still feeling exhausted is a real disorder.

quiz.question: What distinguishes idiopathic hypersomnia from narcolepsy?
options: There is no cataplexy and no clear cause despite excessive sleepiness
